name: market for grass fibre | grass fibre | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/385/documentation

This is a market activity, representing a treatment mix. In the case of products needing treatment, market mixes are supplied by the activities treating the product in the geography defined by the market, and they supply the activities needing to treat the product, as they have generated it as a by-product in the Undefined processes (present as a negative input in system models). Transport to the treating facility or losses are also accounted in this type of markets, when relevant.;This is the market for  'grass fibre', in the Global geography.;In this market, expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations.;The product 'grass fibre' is a by-product of ethanol and biogas production from grass. Ethanol is produced from grass by means of fermentation and has the by-products of grass fibre and protein feed, 100% crude. Biogas is produced from grass in a bio-refinery (grass-refinery) that delivers three co-products: biogas, proteins and fibres. Grass fibre is used in energy feed for animals.

The activity starts with the input from the treatment processes.

A market for a material for treatment (wastes or recyclables) ends with the provision of treatment, i.e. a mix of treatment providers, to activities that generate the reference product as a waste/by-product.
